topics.name: Reputation & Brand
topics.description: Development, protection and risk management regarding brand and reputation in target markets.

topics.name: Organisational Capability
topics.description: The organisation requires different skills and roles in order to perform effectively. The correct individuals and teams are organised in a way to achieve the optimum outcomes for the organisation.

topics.name: Strategic Alignment
topics.description: Defined strategy, understood, project alignment to strategy, tech alignment to strategy, tech future proofing.

topics.name: Financial
topics.description: Running costs (types of spend e.g. change, run; underspend, overspend), return (is this measured),  funding model.

topics.name: Cultural & Communication
topics.description: To what degree does the culture and communication modes balance openness, progress, integrity, accountability and risk management. Are there contra-indicators - e.g. unhealthy levels of risk aversion, culture of blame.

topics.name: Sovereignty
topics.description: Ownership and control over the products, business opportunities and data

topics.name: Business agility
topics.description: Ability to implement or accept change (either tech or business/products), timeframe to implement change, tied to financial funding model.

topics.name: Business Environment
topics.description: The organization’s mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and prioritized; this information is used to inform cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions.

topics.name: Strategy
topics.description: The service's alignment to broader strategic goals with respect to data. That is - how the organisation plans to aggregate data from across business units, to support its broader initiatives.

topics.name: Metrics
topics.description: Tracking and metrics regarding data (volumes, categories, velocity, quality indicators)

topics.name: Governance (Data)
topics.description: The service's adherence to policies on the firm's approach to data quality, ownership & accountability, dissemination & consumption, access control, security and storage.

topics.name: Privacy
topics.description: The set of concerns regarding the privacy required during the collection, aggregation and utilisation of data. This will include the use, disclosure, accuracy, security, categorisation and identity of data. The conformance to all legislation, policies, regulations and applicable codes of conduct.

topics.name: Information Protection Processes and Procedures
topics.description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets.

topics.name: Vendor Agreements
topics.description: Contracts and agreements that govern how vendors and client operate with relation to the service or capability.

topics.name: Compliance & Legal
topics.description: Processes by which the service  ensures compliance, regulatory and legal requirements are embedded into its process.

topics.name: Portability
topics.description: The ability to move from one platform, technology, vendor or service provider to another. Where a capability is provided through more than one vendor this includes the relationships and dependencies in such agreements that are required to be met.

topics.name: Metrics
topics.description: Capability of the organisation to have behaviour and prioritisation driven by data and metrics.

topics.name: Industry Standards
topics.description: Ensuring the utilisation standards and best practices where these are applicable.

topics.name: SDLC Controls
topics.description: Standardised, defined and documented framework that all projects and programs across the bank use to effectively and efficiently deliver projects whilst controlling and minimising risk

topics.name: Risk Assessment
topics.description: The organization understands the cybersecurity risk to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, or reputation), organizational assets, and individuals.

topics.name: Risk Management Strategy
topics.description: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support operational risk decisions.

topics.name: Change Management
topics.description: The alignment to a defined organisational process that enables an application to transition from a current state to a desired state. The maturity of tooling used to actuate change of state with minimal risk.

topics.name: Incident Management
topics.description: The tooling and processes enabling an appropriate response to incidents and the alignment with broader incident management frameworks throughout the organisation.

topics.name: Service Management
topics.description: The list of all activities (including policies, processes and procedures) that are required to be performed in order to design,plan, deliver, operate, maintain and control any services delivered to the organisation or customers.

topics.name: Service Continuity
topics.description: The ability to restore services in the event of a disaster (e.g. loss of data centre) that destroys or interrupts service for some or all of the business's resources. A Business Continuity event, and the processes, procedures and specific actions taken in such event to ensure that service will be restored in a timely manner with no loss of data.

topics.name: Knowledge Management
topics.description: Capability  with respect to capture and dissemination of ops-relevant knowledge throughout the SDLC, quality of the service's documentation for its operators, captured learnings from incidents, and ongoing refinements.

topics.name: Asset Management
topics.description: Asset Management (ID.AM): The data, personnel, devices, systems, and facilities that enable the organization to achieve business purposes are identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organization’s risk strategy.

topics.name: Event Management
topics.description: Anomalous activity is detected and the potential impact of events is understood.

topics.name: Monitoring
topics.description: The process of measuring application performance, availability and user experience and using this data to identify and resolve application issues before they impact customers

topics.name: Governance (Security)
topics.description: The policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the

topics.name: Availability
topics.description: The expected reliability of a computer system including software, hardware and networks

topics.name: Performance
topics.description: The degree to which a service aligns with mandated performance metrics, and the degree to which the performance and efficiency of the service is targeted, tracked and measured.

topics.name: Scalability
topics.description: The ability of a system to accommodate an increasing number of elements, process growing volumes of work gracefully and where capacity can be expanded.

topics.name: Maintainability
topics.description: The set of attributes that bear on the effort needed to make specified modifications to a system or service. The ease with which a system or component may be modified to correct faults, improve performance or adapt to a changed environment. The ease with which a system may be retained in, or restored to a state in which it performs its required functions.

topics.name: Manageability
topics.description: The ease of administration and configuration of a system. Including the processes to track and manage all individual configuration items. The sponsorship, knowledge of technology, support training and vendor management required for a system, service or component.

topics.name: Testability
topics.description: The degree to which a software system or a unit thereof supports its own testing, including the repeatability, automation and the accurate and timely reporting of the results.

topics.name: Security
topics.description: The set of cyber security strategies that prevents unauthorised access to organisational assets including systems, hardware, networks and data. Maintaining the integrity and confidentiality of sensitive information. Preventing unauthorised access.

topics.name: Usability
topics.description: The degree to which a system can be used by specified consumers to achieve quantified objectives with effectiveness, efficiency and satisfaction within a quantified context of use.

topics.name: Auditability
topics.description: The ability of a system to generate or obtain required artifacts to provide assurance that the system is safe, data integrity is maintained and the system is operating effectively. Compliance with all requirements including standards, policies, laws and service level agreements (SLA)

topics.name: Organisational Architectural Alignment
topics.description: Alignment with the technology strategy, models and patterns as described within a reference architecture for the organisational capability.

topics.name: Infrastructure
topics.description: The infrastructure used to deliver the business capabilities required for the organisation. The operational processes related to ongoing  management and upkeep to ensure the provision of service.

topics.name: Cloud Readiness (Public/Hybrid)
topics.description: The assessment of all application and data required to deliver the capability and the ability to migrate these components to the cloud with minimal business disruption.

topics.name: Functional Alignment
topics.description: Aligned to Business capability and a broader alignment to support organisational direction; the level of functional fit against the requirements of the organisation.

topics.name: Integration complexity
topics.description: The overall complexity of the system architecture required to deliver the organisational capability; this may require a system of systems with an overarching component model and context. Intergrational complexity includes the number of nodes, the connections between these nodes and the definition of the interfaces between the various components.

topics.name: SDLC Process
topics.description: The process used by the organisation to deliver software, including the design, development, testing and packaging of the overall solution to deliver software in a repeatable, methodical way to ensure completion within time and cost estimates.

topics.name: Technical Debt
topics.description: The implied additional cost or risk that is incurred by a business for implementation of solutions that do not align to the defined strategy of the organisation.

topics.name: Goals
topics.description: Does the technology align to broader departmental goals (e.g. Simplification, Re-use) demonstrating value contributions to these larger goals and business value drivers.

topics.name: External Architectural Alignment
topics.description: Alignment with vendor and/or industry body technology strategies and standards.

topics.name: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control
topics.description: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities is limited to authorized users, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions.
